definition: to accept a gift/to acknowledge greetings
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Present have which kind of strength must present a gift in return present so as to person who receive gifts?
sentences.chinese: 礼物中有何种力量使得受礼者必须回赠礼物？

sentences.english: The givers chose presents with care and imagination, and hoped the recipients would treasure them.
sentences.chinese: 送礼者发挥想象力，精挑细选，希望受礼者珍爱。

sentences.english: Finally, there are items that a recipient would like to receive but not purchase.
sentences.chinese: 最后，有些上平受礼人会接受却不会去购买。

definition: to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
etiquette/(old) gradation of etiquette with social status
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)
